sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not associative with respect to Cartesian product.
message_1: Let set A = {1, 2, 3} and set B = {2, 3, 4}. Find the symmetric difference of A and B, denoted as A Δ B, using the Cartesian product. Then, find the symmetric difference of B and A, denoted as B Δ A, using the same method. Show that the results are not equal, hence proving that the symmetric difference of two sets is not associative with respect to the Cartesian product.
